snippet: Officials said drivers could use the bridge as workers continue with repairs, and a new part of the San Francisco-Oakland Bay Bridge will open to traffic the first week of September.
abstract: California transportation officials announce that new eastern half of San Francisco-Oakland Bay Bridge will open to traffic the first week of September after all, reversing an earlier decision to delay opening after defective earthquake safety bolts were found; say drivers can use bridge as workers continue with repairs.
lead_paragraph: Officials said drivers could use the bridge as workers continue with repairs, and a new part of the San Francisco-Oakland Bay Bridge will open to traffic the first week of September.

headline.main: Bolt Problem Won’t Delay San Francisco Bridge’s Opening
headline.print_headline: Bolt Problem Won’t Delay San Francisco Bridge’s Opening
